intro: Baeckea crenatifolia, commonly known as the serrated baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. It typically grows in coastal heathlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions. Baeckea crenatifolia is often found in coastal regions of New South Wales and southern Queensland.
